directive_ref: CEO DIRECTIVE WAVE 15/15A - AUTONOMOUS GOLDEN NEEDLE HUNT WITH SOURCE ATTRIBUTION

The crypto sector went increasingly mainstream in 2025, with regulatory moves in Australia, US states exploring Bitcoin reserves and new...
Bitcoin has entered a critical make-or-break phase as price clings to key weekly support while momentum continues to fade.
Executives and lobbyists attended a meeting today with Senator Tim Scott and others to hash out the ongoing talks over crypto's most...
Despite its relative volatility, cryptocurrency has gained significant attention as a legitimate financial asset in the global market.

hypothesis_content.title: Fading Failed Momentum Breakouts in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp 1-hour price spike (>1.5%) on low relative volume (< 80% of 20-period average) that fails to sustain a break above the prior session's high will reverse fully within the next 4 hours, providing a short-term mean-reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound action and a lack of sustained directional conviction. A low-volume spike that fails is a classic sign of a 'stop hunt' or weak speculative push, not genuine buying pressure. The market is likely to quickly reject this move, snapping back into the established range.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle shows a >1.5% price increase from open to high
The volume for that candle is below 80% of the 20-hour average volume
The candle's high exceeds the previous daily (UTC) high, but the candle closes below that prior daily high (a failed breakout)
The 1-hour RSI(14) at candle close is > 65

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to the midpoint of the triggering 1-hour candle
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price establishes a new 4-hour high above the entry candle's high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: After a valid entry signal, price continues to rise and hits the stop-loss before the take-profit in more than 40% of cases, indicating failed breakouts in neutral regimes can sometimes ignite genuine momentum.
